svg:

ContainersThe Problem They Were Invented to Solve:Linux KernelDistribution- Linux Namespaces a feature in the kernelthat allows you to segment a machine intonamespaces that provide isolation from appliationsrunning in other namespaces. "Lightweight" virtual machines.An application cannot easily impact negatively other applications running on that machine.Docker - made it so you can declaratively describe the namespacein which your application will run.Let's make it easier to move application into production.("Container") - "Shipping the environment your application needs to production"- Fast- they do these containers in "layers" - each layer is created by us to enable fast updates. - We try to design our container images such that: - The stuff that changes most frequently (our app) is in the "Top" layer, - Lower layers change less frequently.Base Distribution of LinuxDotnet Runtime Stuff (6.0)Our Nuget Packages (dependencies)Compiled Application"Container Image"Read only(Immutable)Base Distribution of LinuxDotnet Runtime Stuff (6.0)Our Nuget Packages (dependencies)Compiled ApplicationRead only(Immutable)"Docker Run"Read / WriteContainerWSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux)provides the Kernel
